alert.note: Alert for Lake Mead National Recreation Area; Northwest Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 12 at 12:45AM MST until September 12 at 3:00AM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: .The remnant circulation of Kay will move across the Desert Southwest, triggering a final round of thunderstorms with heavy rain. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arizona and southern Nevada, including the following areas, in northwest Arizona, Lake Mead National Recreation Area and Northwest Plateau. In southern Nevada, Lake Mead National Recreation Area, Las Vegas Valley, Northeast Clark County and Sheep Range. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Several rounds of thunderstorms with heavy rain will occur over the watch area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Lake Mead National Recreation Area; Northwest Plateau
